docs.summary: The `task` object represents all information available for tasks. A task is a specific action or assignment to be completed.

permissions.name: Manage Tasks
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's tasks

permissions.name: Read Tasks
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's tasks

params.name: filter

docs.summary:
Counts the number of tasks. 


This endpoint returns the count of all tasks regardless of the task `status`. 

Optionally, you can pass a filter to count only tasks based 
on specified criteria.

extra.description: Count tasks by a query with filter and sort

permissions.name: Manage Tasks
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's tasks

params.name: beforeTaskId
params.doc:
The task ID after which the moved task is positioned in the display. 
If `beforeTaskId` is not provided, the moved task is positioned first in the display of tasks.

docs.summary:
Moves a task specified by ID to be placed after another task in the display.

You can reposition a task to be first in the display by ommitting `beforeTaskId`.

extra.description: Change a task position in the tasks list

permissions.name: Manage Tasks
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's tasks

permissions.name: Read Tasks
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's tasks

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of tasks, given the provided paging, filtering, and sorting. 

Query Tasks runs with the following defaults, which you can override: 
- `_createdDate` in `DESC` order

For field support for filters and sorting, see [Tasks: Supported Filters and Sorting](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/crm/tasks/task-v2/filter-and-sort).

To learn about working with _Query_ endpoints, see [API Query Language](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/api-query-language), [Sorting and Paging](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/sorting-and-paging), and [Field Projection](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/field-projection).

examples.title: Queries first page Tasks

extra.description: Retrieves tasks by a query with filter and sort

examples.title: Queries second page Tasks

extra.description: Retrieves tasks by a query with cursor
Retrieves empty list when there is no tasks that match the filter

permissions.name: Manage Tasks
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's tasks

params.name: mask
params.doc: Explicit list of fields to update.

docs.summary:
Updates a task.

Each time the task is updated, `revision` increments by 1.
The existing `revision` must be included when updating the task.
This ensures you're working with the latest task
and prevents unintended overwrites.

examples.title: Update Task

docs.summary: Triggered when a task reaches its due date.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: Task ID associated with this event.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.doc: Whether this event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (e.g., GDPR).

members.doc: Whether this event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (e.g., GDPR).

members.name: bodyAsJson
members.doc: Event body as a stringified JSON

body:
{
  "id" : "4973f73a-40ef-11ee-be56-0242ac120002",
  "revision" : "2",
  "createdDate" : "2022-08-13T07:43:18.125Z",

  "title" : "Need to call someone",
  "description" : "Explain about your site",
  "dueDate" : "2022-08-17T09:00:00.000Z",
  "status" : "ACTION_NEEDED",
  "source" : {
    "sourceType" : "APP",
    "appId" : "3b916b16-1f2b-4844-8182-96c1deeecee5",
    "userId" : "fe213e9b-a560-4bcc-aae4-ef31c4152002"
  },
  "assigneeId" : "f6eb6c40-7379-481e-8d52-58cfb6dc4c9a",

    "lastName" : "One",
    "email" : "email@example.com",
    "phone" : "+97297495550",
    "imageUrl" : "https://www.wix.com/contacts-server/api/v1/metasite/avatar/8046df3c-7575-4098-a5ab-c91ad8f33c47/2528bd01086244efb191c1302d986566/"
  }
}

members.name: revision
members.doc: Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the task is updated. To prevent conflicting changes, the existing `revision` must be used when updating a task.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the task was created.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the task was last updated.

members.name: contact
members.doc: Information about the contact associated with the task.

members.name: sourceType
members.doc: Type for how the task was created.

members.name: appId
members.doc: App ID, if the task was created by an app.

members.name: userId
members.doc: User ID, if the task was created by a user.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the contact associated with the task.

members.name: paths
members.doc: The set of field mask paths.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
 This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
 We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
 Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
 Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
 This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
 Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
 (for example, GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
 For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
  it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
 As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
 To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
  message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Indicates if there are more results after the current page.
 If `true`, another page of results can be retrieved.
 If `false`, this is the last page.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: taskId
members.doc: ID of the task to retrieve.

members.name: mask
members.doc: Explicit list of fields to update.

members.name: taskId
members.doc: ID of the task to delete.

members.name: filter
count
members.doc: The number of tasks that match the provided filter.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

members.name: beforeTaskId
members.doc:
The task ID after which the moved task is positioned in the display. 
If `beforeTaskId` is not provided, the moved task is positioned first in the display of tasks.

members.name: taskId
members.doc: The id of the last task that was re-positioned

members.name: position
members.doc: The position of the last task that was re-positioned

docs.summary:
Possible statuses in which the task may be. Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_STATUS
  • ACTION_NEEDED
  • COMPLETED

Possible sources that can create tasks. Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_SOURCE_TYPE
  • APP
  • USER

`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.
